entry.title: Permit Change of VBEP-ETDAT for partial deliveries in sales order
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

we are using standard ATP  logic in sales orders. 

In some cases schedule line cannot be delivered completely.

System will show these information in delivered qty in tab schedule lines in sales order.

However it is possible to change the delivery date on schedule as long as VBEP-WMENG does not eq sales order qty.

This system behaviour leads to issues in evaluating delivery performance. Is their a possibility to permit these system behaviour?

 

Regards

Andreas Buchholz

entry.title: M3682 - Batch & of material & is already locked by & in MIGO
entry.content:
Dear all, 
could you please help us to solve the following problem in S4 Hana / GUI. 
Issue: We are only for displaying of a material document in MIGO / S4 (gui) and parallel at the same time we want to post a goods movement with the same material and batch by MIGO but we get the error message "M3682 - Batch & of material & is already locked by & in MIGO." The current batch seems to be blocked through the displaying mode of MIGO.
What is the reason for and what kind of customizing settings should be used in the system to be posted a goods movements by MIGO under displaying a material document by MIGO? 

Thanks in advance!

Regards,

J√°nos

entry.title: Issue in S/4HANA ‚Üí SAP Sales Cloud v2 Integration: Wrong Sender/Receiver System IDs Passed
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

we are currently implementing the standard integration between SAP S/4HANA On-Premise and SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 using the official SAP Integration Suite package:

‚ÄúSAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration for Sales Processes with SAP S/4HANA‚Äù
(in particular the iFlow ‚ÄúReplicate Sales Order and Sales Quote from SAP S/4HANA‚Äù)

During our setup we noticed a behavior that appears to be incorrect or at least not documented. The iFLow in SAP Standard expects an IDOC Structure (here message type COD_REPLICATE_SALES_ORDER)

What we observed

When S/4HANA sends sales order replication data to SAP Integration Suite, it uses the following system identifiers:

  • Sender system: S4HCLNT100

  • Receiver system: MY1001354

These are the classical Logical System names.

However, SAP Sales Cloud v2 expects the system identifiers that are defined in the Communication System setup inside Sales Cloud v2, for example:

  • Sender system: S4H_100

  • Receiver system: sap_cloud_crm_my1001354

Because of this mismatch, the standard iFlow fails unless we manually change the mapping inside the iFlow.
After adjusting the mapping, the messages are processed correctly.

Why this is confusing

In the Sales Cloud v2 integration:

  • There is no place in S/4HANA where these system IDs can be adapted specifically for Sales Cloud v2.

  • The standard content in SAP Integration Suite does not expose parameters to override sender/receiver IDs.

  • The documentation does not mention any required mapping.

This means:
The standard iFlow expects the Sales Cloud v2 Communication System IDs, but S/4HANA always sends Logical System IDs.

So the iFlow and the S/4HANA standard do not match each other out-of-the-box.

üí¨ Our question to the community

Is this behavior expected?
Or is this a gap/bug in the standard integration?

Also:
Is there any hidden configuration in S/4HANA to control which system identifiers are passed to the iFlow?
We could not find any.

At the moment, we had to modify the iFlow (which we would prefer to avoid), and we‚Äôd like to know:

  • Does SAP plan to adjust the integration content?

  • Or have other customers found a clean configuration-based solution?

Any guidance, insights, or experiences would be highly appreciated. üòä

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: How to preserve remaining shelf life during post-processing batch creation in SAP?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I‚Äôm working on a project in FMCG spice manufacturing and need guidance on SAP shelf-life handling.

Problem:

  • Raw materials arrive with vendor MFG and EXP (SLED).

  • Materials may spend time in the warehouse before processing (e.g., grinding).

  • Currently, SAP sets the output batch expiry = Process Date + full shelf life, extending expiry incorrectly.

Goal:

  • Calculate output batch expiry as:
    Remaining_Life = Input_EXP minus Process_Date
    New_EXP = Process_Date plus Remaining_Life

  • Or, with fixed post-processing life:
    Candidate_EXP = Process_Date plus Fixed_PostProcess_Life
    New_EXP = the minimum of Input_EXP and Candidate_EXP

  • Earliest expiry should apply when multiple input batches are blended.

Questions:

  1. Is there a standard SAP method, BAdI, or user exit to implement this?

  2. Can it integrate with any already present logics in SAP?

Thanks for the help.

Please help.

Thanks!

entry.title: In public cloud how to get Sales Order Header Text
entry.content:
How can we read Sales Order Header Text in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (clean core, no modification)?

I have tried multiple ways but couldn‚Äôt get the header text of a Sales Order.
In Public Cloud:

  • Read_Text is not allowed

  • Table access to STXH/STXL is not allowed

  • CDS view extensibility for reading text via text-object/text-id is not available

  • BAdI access to SD text API is restricted

  • The only relevant released view is I_SALESORDERTP , but this cannot be used inside our custom CDS view.

entry.title: Incorrect User Lock Error
entry.content:
During the execution of the standard SAP program R\_FINS\_PLAN\_TRANS\_CO\_S4H\_2\_ERP, we encountered the following error: The report was executed by user YYYY, who is different from CCJK.
User CCJK merely launched the CJ40 transaction and is currently modifying a WBS element that is not included in the list of WBS elements belonging to the copy process. We kindly request your support to resolve this issue.  


System: PROD
Server: 10.129.15.106
Client: 300

entry.title: cheque payment payment manual
entry.content:
Heineken has a requirement to Print cheque manually for excise duties which are to be paid via standard transaction (F110) or Fiori app Manage Automatic Payments (F0770). When the payment run is executed and print is scheduled, CORE will print a vendor name, Payment date, payable amount in characters & amount details on the physical cheque leaf.

This Functional specification is concentrated on the physical cheque leaf, on which vendor name, Payment date, Payable amount in characters & amount will be printed when payment run is executed, and print is scheduled.

Cheque form needs to be printed with details like vendor name, Payment date, Payable amount in characters & amount. 

Physical Cheque form will be supplied by bank and below-mentioned details to be printed, and cheque layout is attached below.

The physical cheque form look as below: only Yellow highlighted

all the required details are attached in word document, please go through

entry.title: Perform Installation and dismantling of technical object through service notification or order
entry.content:
We have a requirement currently for our user to perform the installation and dismantling of serializes equipment with reference to service order or NOtification created so they have a history of the equipment usage maintained. Currently we are unable to have any linkage between the service notification and dismantling in fiori. 

We tried using manage structure option in Find technical object but it still does not provide any option to  link the action to the service notification or order

REgards,

Pooja Bhagat

entry.title: Responsibility Definitions and Key Field Mapping for a Team Category
entry.content:
Hi all,

I‚Äôm working with a team category in Responsibility Management and need to understand how it is configured.

In particular, I‚Äôm trying to find out:

  • which responsibility definitions/attributes are assigned to this team category,
  • where this configuration can be viewed or maintained, and
  • which field or key is used for the value help of these attributes.

I‚Äôm investigating this because one of the attribute value helps is showing duplicate entries, and I need to verify which key field the system is using.

Any pointers to transactions or tables would be very helpful. 

Thanks

entry.title: General Recommendation of maximum number of apps / app descriptors in 1 technical catalog?
entry.content:
Hello,

We were working in the structuring of the fiori apps for S4hana 2023. We have 1 business catalog per business role.

When it comes to custom technical catalog for all custom apps, we are thinking of having just 1 technical catalog overall and distribute the apps from it to business catalogs. So our question is will this impact the Performance in anyways if 1 Technical catalog has 1000 of apps ? what is the recommendation from SAP for Technical Catalog Size and structuring? Can't find this information in any sap help portals. 

@Jocelyn_Dart 

 

Thanks,

RK

entry.title: Updates on ODATA V2 Deprecation
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I have confusion on latest rumors' on stopping support for ODATA v2 from SAP. I am not really finding any SAP note on that to get clear idea. Can someone help me to get it and also do you have idea on below points?

  • If ODATA v2 support is going to stop then what will happen to old service/integrations done with non-sap systems after system upgrade?
  • Are ODATA services created through SEGW comes under ODATA v2?
  • If creating ODATA services is not recommended in SEGW then how same can be done in v4 version(may be following RAP Model)?(Any blog or documentation on creating READ, UPDATE, CREATE Operations in ODATA v4 same like how we were doing in SEGW?)

Thanks for your time in reading my queries, please drop ur comments.

Regards,

Omkar

entry.title: Correct HU Status
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

At our company, HUs are packed during the creation of the delivery and the delivery is then distributed to a decentralized EWM system. The HUs then have the VEKP-STATUS = 0050. In addition, VEKP-HU_LGORT is empty and VEKP-HU_SYSTEM = A.

Are these values normal for HUs in this process? The status in the VEKP also does not change later in the process.

We encounter an issue when we later attempt to redistribute HUs with the same EXIDV to the EWM system. (The HU has since left the EWM system again.)

Error message HUSELECT 008 Handling unit &1 posted for goods issue already exists

Thank you for your assistance.
Best regards

entry.title: Error Message No R1201 while creating supplier business parnters
entry.content:
Hi,

We migrated sandbox system from SAP ECC to SAP S/4 system. After migration(in S/4 system)When creating business partner with supplier BP role, we are getting error message R1201.

Business partner <GUID> does not exist.

We analysed our settings based on oss note 2551748 and they look good. Function module BUCP_BUPA_PERSDATA_GET is being called and it is returning error message R1201.

Any assistance on this issue is highly appreciated.

Thank You.
